intro: Lacunaria oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaf lacunaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its opposite arrangement of leaves, which are typically ovate to elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
